name: Healthier Lemon-Ginger Cookies
author: Alberta Rose
summary: Lemon-ginger cookies--a new twist on an old classic. All of the tender texture and good flavor, with added goodness. These are chewy on the inside and crispy on the outside.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons low-fat milk, or more as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Combine sugar and canola oil in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy
Add molasses and egg and beat until fluffy
Stir in flour, ginger, baking powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon lemon zest; mix until well combined
Use a small cookie scoop to measure out teaspoonfuls of dough; place 2 inches apart on an insulated baking sheet and flatten slightly with a spatula
Bake in the preheated oven until edges just start to brown, 12 to 15 minutes; do not overbake
Cool on the baking sheet for 1 minute before removing to a wire rack to cool, 8 to 10 minutes more
Meanwhile, mix together icing sugar, margarine, lemon juice, 1/2 tablespoon lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons milk for the glaze
Mix thoroughly until desired consistency, adding more milk if needed
